positions.description:

positions.title: Software Developer
positions.description:
Onsite projects for major Silicon Valley clients:

- PayPal, 2015: Dashboard for Paypal Node.JS applications: builds, deployments, traffic, availability: Node.JS, MongoDB, Altus Cloud, React.JS
- Ebay, 2012-14: Scalable REST API Backend for “eBay Fashion” Visual Search: C++, STL, Boost.Asio, HTTP, OpenCV, Java, Node.JS, MongoDB, SaaS, PaaS, Altus, Maven, Jenkins, Raptor, feature extraction and recognition, machine learning
- EBay, Analytic Platform & Delivery: Clickstream TIBCO RendezVous Bus Data Listener and file transport pipeline.
- Sony Electronics: Core library for Android Book Reader (EPUB/PDF), built upon Adobe RMSDK
- EBay IMD/UBI: optimizing Ab Initio ™ clickstream reports using C++ API extension.
- Yahoo! SDS: Fetching data from “Petabyte” Postgres DB for real time ad targeting on Hadoop
- Novafora: Compiled (JIT) C++ simulator for new VLIW chip designed to process H.264 video processing in hardware
- PayPal, Infra: MLOC C++ code base refactoring: dependency analysis, service extraction. Refactoring of build system (ICE, make) and C++code base. Porting complete PayPal code base from GCC 2.95 to 4.0 and OS migration from Red Hat 6.2 to RHEL5.
- Yahoo! Briefcase: Converted Briefcase to use distributed system to lift user storage limits.
- Yahoo! Photos: Wrote REST Web Service for Photo Print partner integration, using SOAP
- Cisco Systems: Static Analysis Tools used in development of Cisco IOS, on top of Klocwork and Coverity
- KLA-Tencor: Optimized pipeline of Visual C++ application used to control multi-million defect inspection devices
- Yahoo! Finance: Extended Core XML/XSLT DSO framework. Converting Y! Finance pages to XML/XSLT
- EBay: First “eBay API” SOAP Web Service development, LTS coordination
- Procket Networks, now Cisco: “NPU” Terabyte Router Network CPU simulator
Custom STLport builds:
- for compiler vendors: Nokia, Borland, Hewlett-Packard, SUN/Oracle, IBM
- for internal use: Sony, EMC, General Electric, Wine, eBay

given.text: Boris is a talented developer with a deep understanding of C++ and STL. He also is very skilled with threading and algorithms. He was a good member of the team, and took on extremely challenging architectural tasks. When he made a commitment, he did whatever was necessary to deliver. A great senior developer.

I supervised Boris on two projects at Yahoo. One was to build photo-related e-commerce solutions, and another was to do a massive scale up of Yahoo Briefcase storage. In both cases, Boris could be counted on the deliver on schedule, and deliver a quality product. Recruiters often ask if you would hire a person again given a chance. In Boris's case, I already did that.

Boris is an C++ expert with analytical brilliance, fast execution, and highly focus. At eBay IMD/UBI he optimized several in-house extensions in a multi-platform cluster environment. His farsighted and original recommendations to an existing Tibco/C++ application provided the foundation for a quick and stable expansion. Boris creates an extremely enjoyable professional working environment, it is always a pleasure working with him.

Boris was a team leader when we worked together on the "Itanium killer" CPU project. I really liked working with him, as he is very sharp guy with a lots of technical expertise. His original STLport library was a valuable tool for years before compilers became mature enough to have fully featured native STL.

Boris is an outstanding C++ programmer. He gets up to speed with new projects and starts contributing very quickly. His work is of good quality and reliability. And it was a pleasure to work with him.

I know Boris as a foremost expert in Advanced C++, STL and generic programming methodology. For any C++ question, however complex or tricky, he can always give a quick and in-depth answer. Boris is the author of STLport, a multi-platform, highly portable, ANSI C++ Standard Library implementation.

received.text:
I worked together with Edwin on two projects at eBay. He is remarkably solid and well-rounded professional. 
After many years of industrial experience, he kept his Berkeley vibe. He has this habit getting to the bottom of things - in my book, this takes an engineer to a computer scientist. Yet he is super organized and dependable.
Edwin handles demanding and pressuring projects very professionally and with positive attitude, even through weekend and night Operations support calls.
It was a great pleasure working with Edwin, I would not hesitate to recommend him for a wide range of engineering positions.

Sujata joined AIF team when the project was mature. She got to the speed very quickly and was able to immediately contribute useful and important extensions that she was able to identify quickly thanks to her previous Adobe experience. Sujata led a few new feature projects in AIF team, communicating very successfully with our India team. She also took very enthusiastically on new technologies and quickly became OpenCL leader in our team. Sujata is very diligent and attentive to detail, it was great pleasure working together. I would highly recommend Sujata for Senior/Principal Engineer role, in particular for challenging projects involving heterogenous computing.
